title: US East Coast Cold Snap May Cancel Flights Affecting 10 to 20 Percent of Your American Bookings
summary:
Long range models are converging on a severe cold snap across New York Boston and Chicago hubs from January 30 onwards likely causing major flight cancellations and delays at key US airports. Edinburgh hotels often get 10 to 20 percent of winter bookings from these routes high value guests who frequently cancel or no show when transatlantic flights are disrupted.
Check US origin arrivals from late January in your system send a quick stay anyway email with flexible change options and get ready to open extra rooms for local or UK walk ins if cancellations start coming in.
source: Severe Weather Europe; Watchers News; YouTube meteorologist update

title: Verona Air Traffic Control Ballot May Disrupt Flights Affecting 5 to 15 Percent of Your Italian Bookings
summary:
Union ballots at Verona airport are showing strong support for a January 31 walkout threatening Ryanair and easyJet direct flights from Milan and Verona to Edinburgh. Mid range and central hotels usually have 5 to 15 percent Italian or EU leisure guests on these routes and cancellations would hit revenue straight away.
Filter bookings from Italy especially Verona or Milan around late January to early February send a friendly message offering easy rebooking and think about a small rate drop for UK or EU walk ins if the strike goes ahead.
source: Euronews; The Flight Club; The Local Italy

title: Persistent Cold and Snow Outlook May Reduce Bookings Affecting 15 to 30 Percent of Your UK and European Guests
summary:
ECMWF and GFS models are lining up on a Scandinavian high pushing cold air and snow risk across Scotland from late January into early February with sleet possible in Edinburgh and heavier snow north. Domestic UK and short haul EU guests tend to cancel fast when wintry weather shows up and hotels usually face 15 to 30 percent occupancy drops in these conditions.
Look at bookings from London Manchester Aberdeen and EU low cost airlines send a simple weather update email with flexible rebooking and a little extra perk and get set to lower rates 10 to 15 percent for local or UK walk ins if snow builds up.
source: Severe Weather Europe; Met Office; YouTube update

title: New Mandatory Digital Travel Permits Will Block Non-Visa Arrivals Impacting Up To Twenty Percent Of International Bookings
summary: The UK Home Office will move to full legal enforcement of the Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) scheme starting February 25 with no more soft-launch grace periods. International guests from 85 countries including the USA and EU will be denied boarding at their departure airport if they haven't secured their digital permit at least 72 hours in advance. Identify all international reservations arriving from February 25 onwards and include a Mandatory Travel Permit Required notice in your automated pre-arrival emails to prevent no-shows.
source: UK Government Official News; Home Office Media Factsheet; The 3 Million Advocacy Group
